meanings.sent1: I will relend the book to my friend after I finish reading it.
meanings.sent2: She decided to relend her bicycle to the neighbor for another week.
meanings.sent3: The library had to relend the same book multiple times due to its popularity.
meanings.sent4: He relends his tools like a generous neighbor, always willing to help.
meanings.sent5: The act of relending can create a cycle of sharing and borrowing among friends.

meanings.sent1: After receiving the money back, she chose to relend it to someone else.
meanings.sent2: The bank agreed to relend the funds to support small businesses in the community.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would relend his pen only if it came back with a full ink cartridge.
meanings.sent4: The charity organization decided to relend the donated clothes to those in need.
meanings.sent5: She found joy in the opportunity to relend her favorite childhood storybook to a new generation.
